page.title: 14A COLLIERY WINDER
page.content: After the very early start and a day at work I am ready for finishing at 13.30. When I get home I find that I have to replace a broken window, victim of the cricket ball. Two hours later, I go to see my Dad. Shortly after, the children arrive home from school. I sort out any problems they have. 5pm and it's time to get washed up ready for dinner - a meal I am really looking forward to. I read the Nottingham Evening Post, nothing on television - again! I do some paper work on my hobby which is Railways which fills much of my leisure time. 9pm and it's time to retire to bed, shaving before I go in order to save time the following morning. I read for half an hour,then it's lights out until the 4.30am call and then it's time to start all over again. By Peter Dawson.
